column2:
Flats terrain represents large areas of flat land.
Forest biome represents areas of forest with high density of trees and underbrush which generally slows travel through the area.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+50%§!

Hill terrain represents areas dominated by a rolling landscape of shifting elevation that are lower and less steep than mountains.
Forest biome represents areas of forest with high density of trees and underbrush which generally slows travel through the area.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+83%§!

Mountain terrain represents areas mainly occupied by rugged mountain ranges and narrow passes, often on high altitude and in cold climate.
Forest biome represents areas of forest with high density of trees and underbrush which generally slows travel through the area.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+125%§!

Highland terrain represents areas dominated by a rolling landscape of shifting elevation that are far smoother than mountains. Unlike hilly terrain, highlands are fairly flat yet high-altitude areas that have sudden cliffs or changes in elevation.
Forest biome represents areas of forest with high density of trees and underbrush which generally slows travel through the area.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+100%§!

Flats terrain represents large areas of flat land.
Wooded biome represents areas of fairly open forest with little underbrush which generally allows easier travel than forests.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+25%§!

Hill terrain represents areas dominated by a rolling landscape of shifting elevation that are lower and less steep than mountains.
Wooded biome is characterised by trees sufficiently widely spaced so that the canopy does not close. It generally allows easier travel than forests.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+58%§!

Shrubland biome is characterised by persistent small to medium level plants. Without providing much cover in combat, they are complicated to travel over.

Flats terrain represents large areas of flat land.
Desert biome represents desolate and arid areas with little or no vegetation, often in a very warm climate.  The lack of water in deserts can make travel very hazardous until wells or waterstations are established.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+100%§!

Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+150%§!

Flats terrain represents large areas of flat land.
Jungle biome represents areas overgrown with dense tropical vegetation, difficult for an army to manoeuvre in.  The dense undergrowth and hazards of jungles make travel even more challenging than forest and avenues cleared up for travel must be kept clear of the rapidly encroaching vegetation.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+100%§!

Hill terrain represents areas dominated by a rolling landscape of shifting elevation that are lower and less steep than mountains.
Jungle biome represents areas overgrown with dense tropical vegetation, difficult for an army to manoeuvre in.  The dense undergrowth and hazards of jungles make travel even more challenging than forest and avenues cleared up for travel must be kept clear of the rapidly encroaching vegetation.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+133%§!

Mountain terrain represents areas mainly occupied by rugged mountain ranges and narrow passes, often on high altitude and in cold climate. Mountains have always been formidable nature barriers to any sort of travel, civilian or military.
Tundra biome represents cold grasslands, often with permafrost.  While the open ground is convenient for travel, the constant cold is difficult to manage until better maintained roads with waystations are constructed.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+300%§!
This island is quite small (under 600 km2). It doesn't provide a lot of room to grow, but it makes it an easily defendable strategic point.\nMovement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+50%§!\n
This uninhabited island has abundant trees and fresh water, but is remote. It offers a good rendezvous points for ships travelling from Europe to Asia.
This remote volcanic island offers little appeal to colonists, except as haven for passing ships.

Taiga terrain represents boreal forests which grow in very cold climates.  The huge trees and constant cold pose a major obstacle to travel until roads are cleared and kept ice-free.

Taiga terrain takes 6 * province size amount of days to travel across, and is considered §Rrugged§! terrain.

Each level of road network decreases travel time across this province by a factor depending also on the province size.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+100%§!

Tundra terrain represents cold grasslands, often with permafrost.  While the open ground is convenient for travel, the constant cold is difficult to manage until better maintained roads with waystations are constructed.

Steppe terrain takes 5 * province size amount of days to travel across, and is considered §Ochallenging§! terrain.

Each level of road network decreases travel time across this province by a factor depending also on the province size.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+200%§!

Floodplain terrain represents an area of land adjacent to a stream or river that stretches from the banks of its channel to the base of the enclosing valley walls and experiences flooding during periods of high discharge.

Floodplain terrain takes 4 * province size amount of days to travel across, and is considered §Ochallenging§! terrain.

Each level of road network decreases travel time across this province by a factor depending also on the province size.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+25%§!

Marsh terrain represents tracts of wetland dominated by grasses or low-growing shrubs.  Marshes have always been difficult to traverse until raised roads are lifted above the water.

Marshy terrain takes 6 * province size amount of days to travel across, and is considered §Rrugged§! terrain.

Each level of road network decreases travel time across this province by a factor depending also on the province size.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+150%§!

Arctic terrain represents the snow and ice covered areas close to the North Pole.  Such terrain has always been very difficult and dangerous to cross, and remains so today.

Arctic terrain increases CE distance by 1, this cannot be reduced.
Movement cost compared to Grass Flats : §R+100%§!
Controlling this important river junction strengthens our hold of the trade in the region.
Controlling this important river junction strengthens our hold of the trade in the region.
Controlling this important river junction strengthens our hold of the trade in the region.
This province is naturally suited to become a local Centre of Trade and controlling it will help control trade in the region.

A natural harbour is a landform where a part of a body of water is protected and deep enough to furnish anchorage. Natural harbours have long been of great strategic naval and economic importance, and many great cities of the world are located on them. §YNatural Harbour §! is required for building a §GGrand Shipyard§!.
Some coasts are naturally ill-suited for having proper ports and it is difficult and expensive to build proper naval facilities in such areas.

A strait is a naturally formed, narrow, typically navigable waterway that connects two larger bodies of water. Most commonly it is a channel of water that lies between two land masses. Controlling them allows a better control of the trade in the region.
[This.GetName] is located at the confluence of several rivers, granting the owner of this province an advantage in trade.
Paved Road allow greater speed of movement for armies and facilitate trade.
Roads allow greater speed of movement for armies and facilitate trade.
